website_summaries.verdict: This exceptionally rated travel mug is perfect for buyers wanting a larger steel container.
pros: Self-sealing technology keeps mug leak-proof between sips
Keeps drinks hot for five hours and cold for 12
Comes in large and small sizes, alongside a variety of colors
cons: Many customers had issues with mold growing on the lid without proper maintenance

customer_reviews.title: What have I been drinking?!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the stainless version of this mug for about a year, and I have only washed it by hand. I was washing it the other day and noticed some weird material flaking off of the inside! I was under the impression that these were completely stainless steel, but it seems like there is some kind of lining on the inside that has started to come off. I can't believe that I have been ingesting whatever this stuff is... hopefully not something toxic. I'm not even going to bother with the lifetime warranty, I have no interest in getting another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Hidden mold!!
customer_reviews.text: High chance of mold in the lid around and under the spring and behind the flap. Very hard to fully clean. Do extreme cleaning on this, we never noticed the hidden mold and have been sick and feeling horrible for a few weeks. It doesn't disassemble enough to clean all the way. We would wash them daily. Found chunks when we used a tooth pick under and around the spring. We absolutely loved these cups at first, we have about 6. We will be searching for a different design that we can actually clean thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Contigo lifetime guarantee is a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set of cups. One of the lids had an obvious manufacturer defect, as it broke off at the rim right where the "push to clean" button is. This caused the lid to leak, which is a potential burn hazard if the cup contained a hot beverage. I reported it to Contigo not once but twice, with photos attached, because there is a LIFETIME GUARANTEE. Contigo never bothered to respond to either message. My advice: don't purchase their products. The lifetime guarantee means nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this one. I don't like having a lot of coffee mugs and just wanted one that I knew would keep my coffee hot for hours, would fit in the cup holder in my car, would not spill through my running around and has a pleasant design. Looked at some articles before finally deciding on this one. I can take sip of my coffee now 5 hours into work and my coffee is still hot. Love this mug so much! If you are on fence, go for it! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexica

customer_reviews.title: Quality has plummeted...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my larger contigo thermos for 4 years and purchased this set for my husband at Christmas. BOTH have broken already. The spring mechanism is weak and we are so incredibly disappointed. I've raved for years and will be contacting the manufacturer. Today, the lid wouldn't seal and I ended up covered in hot coffee while out at a museum with my twin toddlers. Everything in thr diaper bag reeks and some items were ruined. Nightmare!
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you have arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty bad hands with poor grip strength. The button is basically impossible for me to press with my finger tips. I assumed it would be a very easy button, but you have to completely press the button all the way down to get a good flow of coffee. I had to give it to my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The definition of leak proof
customer_reviews.text: This is truly leak proof. When I first got it, I was confused as to how to get coffee to come out of it. I thought I just had to press the tab on the top of the lip to unlock it and coffee would come out. Nope. I finally figured out that you have to unlock it and press on the button that’s on the side to release the coffee. After this ordeal, it’s safe to say this is pretty air tight. There’s also a thing to push under the lid for when you want to clean it, which is pretty convenient. Overall, it’s a great product. It’s sturdy, keeps my coffee warm and is worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: ling

customer_reviews.title: Does not honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. They advertise a life time warranty for their products, but I submitted 3 requests to replace a defective lid that started leaking. Only after the third attempt did I even get a reply from Contigo, but they then failed to follow up after I submitted all the necessary information (multiple pictures, order number, etc.) Only after going to social media to express my disappointment did I get further follow up which was also eventually ignored. This company doesn't seem to stand by their product or their, so called, life time warranty. Only purchase a mug/cup from them if you're comfortable paying full price for a replacement if it ever leaks.
customer_reviews.author: E Miller

customer_reviews.title: Definitely leak-proof!
customer_reviews.text: The marble pattern is so pretty and elegant, plus it goes with all outfits. Definitely leak-proof. I throw it in my purse during my commute to and from work (with a lot of coffee in it) and not a single drop has ever come out.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Love them.  But i'll be buying 2 silver ones next time though...
customer_reviews.text: i love these travel mugs. I usually have 3 in rotation at a time. They are the perfect size! Completely spill proof and keeps my coffee hot during my ride into work. My one gripe is, i must be rugged with my cup holder cause my top rack is not that strong and the blue one is chipping away after 3 months of use! My last ones lasted 3 years, and yes that paint chopped away too so they didnt appear to fix that problem. I also do want to add that the older style shut design was starting to see its use so I think this new slide method appears to fix the West and tear ball shut design.
customer_reviews.author: JJW

customer_reviews.title: I PREFER THE OLDER VERSION....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this travel mug after immensely enjoying the older version for a couple of years. Although it is easier to clean the inside lid of the new one, I prefer the older version. I prefer the size of that one as well, and I believe that it holds heat longer than the new version.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: Contigo finally got it RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago, I started buying Contigo coffee cups with locking lid, since my husband kept staining the carpet in our vehicles, spilling his coffee. I bought him this one with a handle and a 2-pk from Costco (no handles). He likes this one much better, because of the handle. However, the best part of the new Contigo design, is under the lid. The old lids were hard to clean, no matter how much you soaked/scrubbed them, put in the dishwasher ...chunks of black stuff would keep coming out. It was really gross. NOW the plastic part under the lid, flips up, so you can easily clean it. Great idea. Thank you Contigo.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Truly Non-spill Stainless, Insulated Travel Mugs
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these stainless steel, insulated travel mugs. They are the only honestly non-spill mug I have come across. They come in various sizes and volumes. Some are tall and some are small. I do advise, measure the height under your Keurig. If the mug you want is too tall, you won't be happy. The Contigo also has a line of non-metal travel mugs. Insulated mugs keep the beverage temperature you want for a long time - hours. Check them out - buy a couple. You will enjoy the Contigo stainless insulated travel mug.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay, but not as good as the previous generation design
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Holds more liquid than the previous generation design. Durable body a anodize color CONS: These cups are not as nice as the previous generation design. The lid is harder to clean and if you try to get into the nooks and crannies, its easy to dislodge the mechanism which then releases a spring that is very hard to get inserted again correctly. The lids also seem to start tasting like dishwater, so we have to run the lid ONLY through the dishwasher every few days to clean off the coffee grime that builds up in the lid (since they are hard to wash by hand)
customer_reviews.author: jmorton

customer_reviews.text: I got it in White Marble color, it’s beautiful. As it was mentioned in other reviews, some liquid remains near the hole and it might drip a bit, but it’s fine. Just need to be careful. The print is not perfect. See pictures. Not a disaster, but catches the eye. There is a big list of what can and can’t be done. Well... Overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: be careful not to over fill. it will leak through the vent hole. I got coffee all over myself on the way to Church. Also compared to the Thermos cup, the part of the top that you drink from is too shallow, and may cause spillage. I often refill in the car, be aware that if you remove the top in the car to refill from a thermos, the top will drip over the seat and console.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Best for people with big faces.
customer_reviews.text: This cup must have been designed with men in mind. The lid on previous version was concave like a bowl so there was room for your nose when tipping it to drink. This new version has the center of the lid raised and I have to tip my head way back to drink out of it. My nose hits the raised center. My nose is average size for a woman, not big. Not sure why they changed the design, it sucks unless you have a big face.
customer_reviews.author: MomfromMN

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and good quality water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality water bottle, keeps water cold for long time and it is very handle to take everywhere along. I've been using Contigo for a while already and it is good quality. However, it is the second one I bought cause my first one began to leak water, the stamp stopped to perform as good as it was.
customer_reviews.author: Ariane Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Their customer service sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband. It was his favorite cup till a piece on the lid broke. My husband has contacted them via their website because they claim lifetime warranty on the lids. He has been ignored for months now. He has filled out their website form and emailed them a few times. You shouldn’t claim lifetime lid warranty and then completely ignore your customers.
customer_reviews.author: IN

customer_reviews.title: Version 2 not so hot
customer_reviews.text: Push button failed in a few months and would no longer open the lid seals. Contigo did replace it after sending pictures of travel mug malfunctioning. I did take the handle apart to discover the lever that opens the seals had failed. Seems it's design isn't sufficient to take the stress of repeatedly opening over time. My version 1 of this mug is still going strong and a much better design.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Kingston

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not leak-proof
customer_reviews.text: The autoseal is a nice addition, but the lid leaks through the lock. It caused my hot chocolate to spill all over my lap! Update: I'm not a fan of negative reviews, but I believe Contigo really blew it on this one. I bought a coffee mug, not a Nerf gun. This morning I had my beverage in it and the mug was sealed- fine. It titled and the hot chocolate started spraying out of the lid with the force of a thousand hurricanes! It went all over my kitchen and in my mom's face, burning her.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Leaked First Time I Used It
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this top rated travel mug from Contigo. I looked on several websites to compare reviews....this one always came out on top. I got the plain stainless steel. IT LEAKED RIGHT OFF THE BAT! It still leaks, even after my husband has fiddled with it over and over. It flat LEAKS-right down the front of the mug and onto my shirt. I guess it's possible I got a one-in-a-million defective mug-who knows? But if I do use it I can only put water in it. Could have been worse-might have been hot coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie53

customer_reviews.title: Have always loved the Contigo products but a couple of things about ...
customer_reviews.text: Have always loved the Contigo products but a couple of things about this one I don't like are: 1) The top has a raised section in the middle that smashes against your nose - previous versions were not designed like this. 2) This version does not seem to keep coffee hot for as long as the Randolph one.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the laek/spill proof idea.... Well it leaks through the button you press. Does it on both units. So that means still get coffee on me and in the holder. Other than that it is good. But that is a major flaw. So sad....
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They don’t stay hot for to long Maybe for 2 1/2 hrs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks around the button!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a double pack. Mine leaks when I press the button and his does not. I don't understand this. I'd really like a fix to this. I love the mug itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee cut but disappointed in chipped paint.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cup specifically for the chic design and leak proofness. The leak proofness is awesome! and I love the feel of the coffee cup in my hand however the paint has a chip in it already and I've only used it 6 times. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tenille

customer_reviews.title: Diameter is slightly too large for my car's cup holders
customer_reviews.text: Diameter is snug for larger cup holders and too large for some cup holders. I ended up getting the Zojirushi SM-KHE48XA Stainless Steel Mug (16-Ounce). The Zojirushi fits cup my car's holders better, and the sipping spout is a little nicer. Because it has a "redundant" lid, the Zojirushi lid _seems_ more secure against spills, although its pop-over lid is less elegant than the Contigo's lack of a floppy lid. If the Contigo West Loop were just a few millimeters smaller in diameter, and the sip spout a little larger, then I'd probably prefer it to the Zojirushi, because its design is more elegant and aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: mijagourlay

customer_reviews.title: Leaking after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This cup worked fine up to about 6 months. Then started to leak out of exhaust point on to my shirts. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Really doesnt spill!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! it seriously does not spill. I got it because i always just throw my mugs into my backpack. This one seriously does not spill. Even without the lock button, it never has leaked, but the lock button is an extra bonus. It is also a great size. I got the marble one and i LOVE it. Highly recommend this, plus such a great price. Also i saw that in some of the reviews, people mention it came dented. I can confirm that mine came in perfect condition! Maybe they fixed the problem :)
customer_reviews.author: Juliet J.

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep coffee hot for 5 hours
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat disappointed. I was expecting a lot more based on all the good reviews. My coffee didn’t stay hot for more than 2-3 hours. As each hour past, the temperature definitely went down faster than expected. By the 4th hour my coffee was already almost at room temperature. I was using the Thermos brand before purchasing this mug, and the Thermos definitely kept my coffee much warmer and for a longer period of time. I will keep it since I don’t like returning used items, but I will be purchasing another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Julie H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, easy to clean, but difficult to drink from
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that would fit in my car's cup holder and it did. I also wanted to be able to obviously lift it and drink easily from it. Granted, I have rheumatoid arthritis so some things can be awkward for me or too heavy. This was a little bit heavy but not so much that I would comment on it as an issue. The worst part about it is the lip around the area where you drink from is too hi. As someone else said you have to hold it in an awkward angle and tikt back your head further than I would hope while driving. I Should Have heeded that persons advice. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Catwell

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my coffee hot!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had the best experience with travel mugs in the past, they’ve leaked, pooled condensation, made my coffee taste weird when the bottles got hot, etc. This mug is amazing. I filled it up with coffee at 7:45 and it was still nice and hot at 10:30 am! (Yes it took me that long to finish my coffee, mom life). It’s so easy to clean, doesn’t leak, fits perfectly in my car cup holder. The only thing some people may not like is that the print looks like it had a “drip” when drying, but it’s a marble pattern and doesnt bother me at all. Will definitely buy more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have had a previous style Contigo travel cup for hot beverages and they have worked very well in the past. This is the first time that I have bought the Contigo water bottle. The button to open works very well and it is ergonomics design works for hands that have arthritis, however the handle is a little tight and difficult to move up and down. Regarding the hot travel mug which also has the same type of open and close button which works very well. It has an additional safety feature where there is a button that prevents the button to be opened until it is removed and helps to contain the hot liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: If you want a great , insulated and spill-proof travel mug, this is it! (Consider 24 oz size tho)
customer_reviews.text: I am very active and work outdoors. I also hike an average of 5 to 10 miles each week. I wanted a spill-proof insulated travel mug so I bought.... another brand. It leaked. I’m not happy. Then I saw the Contigo mugs and decided to buy one. LOVE IT. Works terrific, does not leak, and the insulation works well enough for what I need. I have 3 total Contigo travel mugs, one just for coffee, one just for cold drinks and hiking and a third to give as a gift. They’re tall and narrow, so not as stable standing on their own perhaps, but work great in any cup holder. I really like these Contigo travel mugs!
customer_reviews.author: Venturin

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful cup
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this cup. I use it at work and at home and I love it. My son tipped it over and there was no mess or spill of any kind! I’m happy it’s a good size for me too considering I’m trying to cut back on how much caffeine I’m consuming per day. It came very fast even through everything that’s happening in the world right now. I definitely recommend this cup to any coffee/tea drinkers. A great on the go cup as well.
customer_reviews.author: Devera Rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and is impossible to clean well!
customer_reviews.text: After being a steady buyer of Contigo products this was the first product that did not reach my standards. The water bottle constantly leaks and the cover has crevices that are impossible to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hot stuff hot and cold stuff cold.
customer_reviews.text: The 16oz West Loop Travel Mug keeps my tea hot for hours. It is totally spill proof, no matter how many times i knock it over it does not spill. The 20 oz Chill Water Bottle really keeps stuff ice cold. My husband fills it up with half water and half ice and leaves it in the car while he works. When he comes out after a 4 or 5 hour shift, the water is still ice cold. Even in the heat of Summer in the hot car, it stays cold. I wish I would of bought both of these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan C.

customer_reviews.title: You will love these cups and take them everywhere you go
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest I have used these cups for years. They keep hot things hot and cold things cold for many hours. As long as you do not put these in the dishwasher and you handle them the way the instructions say you will have them for life. They are very durable and they're very flexible as far as what you can put and them. Truly anything from coffee to wine. You will love these cups and take them everywhere you go. They are attractive and functional. Clean up is a breeze. Do yourself a favor and make the investment. You will not regret it or they will buy them back.
customer_reviews.author: phillip smith

customer_reviews.title: One began to rust inside
customer_reviews.text: We had issues where one of the mugs began rusting on the inside after only a few months of ownership, even though it was always hand washer, never once in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: StormsNYC

customer_reviews.title: A little soapy...
customer_reviews.text: Love the lock/leak proof function however cleaning the lid is a bit challenging. You really have to rinse thoroughly with piping hot water and pump water using button. I've had a few soapy beverages although I thought I did a good cleanse. Otherwise perfect cup holder fit, cute design, truly leak proof...I even toss it in my Louis without pause. Overall I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nika's Kitchen Chronicles on YT

customer_reviews.title: Bottom of mug fell off when unwrapped
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and gifted Contigo mugs like this before (gifting is how I ended up needing a new one). Usually love them as they are great, with zero problems. To my huge disappointment, when I unwrapped my new mug, the bottom cap simply fell off... Seems it wasn't properly attached at the factory (glued? Soldered? heat clamped?) Currently debating dealing with having to wait 30 days for a replacement AND facing the hassle of going to a mail center to mail back the bad one, or if I want to go buy some superglue to fix this one.
customer_reviews.author: James Farren

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised because this bottle does not work anymore Does not keep the ice and the water come hot at 3-4 hours I have others contigo bottles that I’ve been use them for a long time and they work good I don’t know what happened with it Maybe this model does not have the quality than the others
customer_reviews.author: Blue Angel

customer_reviews.title: Was great until....
customer_reviews.text: Was great for a few months and then it started leaking. As I take good care of all my belongings I see this as a manufacturing fail and not something I did.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia T

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I had several problems with this: 1. It's too broad at the base to fit in my car's drink holder. 2. You have to press a button on the rear with your index finger in order to open it while drinking. I have arthritis in my hands and this just doesn't work well for me. 3. It's heavy. 4. I don't like that you can't take apart the lid mechanism for cleaning. 5. Because the place where you drink doesn't have a lip, it's easy to dribble a drop or two when you finish drinking. It's sleek and seems well made, so if these things aren't an issue for you, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaly

customer_reviews.title: disapointed
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks of use the sides near the bottom are all scratched up from my car cup holder- and it's not because the fit is too tight! I don't like smashing my nose into the center. I don't like having to push the button every time I want to take a sip. I had a different travel mug that it had on or off positions. The lid seems like it won't last- cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Warning: the red wine "very berry" color is PINK, not red or wine.
customer_reviews.text: The red color shown is definitely more pink than red. Unfortunately, I bought it for my dad so looks like he will just be getting one instead of two. I wish they would have done a better job of portraying the color on here. The picture definitely looks like a red wine, maroon, dark cherry color so the description name of "very berry" made sense but when I received it, it was not red, wine or maroon at all....it was definitely pink. If this wasn't a rushed order, I would return it for a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Streifert

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermos I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This review is pretty simple. There were three things I wanted in a thermos. I wanted something that wouldn't leak since I would be keeping it in a side pocket for my backpack (which would cause this to change orientation often). I wanted something that would keep my coffee hot for hours. Lastly, I wanted something that was easy to use. I was glad to find that this excelled at all these things. My only gripe is that the top could be a pain to clean properly, but I find that soaking it in hot water once a week does a fine job in keeping odors away. It could be a nuisance, but its pros heavily outweigh this one con.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful leakproof thermal cup.
customer_reviews.text: I use this cup every day, and I constantly lay it on it's side and it never leaks. At first I was hesitant to trust it, now I don't even think about it. It is constantly dependable at not leaking. Nothing sticks out of it to get caught on things when I put it in bags of stuff, and the lid screws on correctly every time, unlike other cups I've had. I love the ease of cleaning design of the top, and I just like the way it looks. I'm very pleased with it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: animal.lover

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to open and tiny spout
customer_reviews.text: Got this today and tried the auto seal button and immediately felt pain in my hands. The button is on the opposite side of the spout which means you’re using your middle and ring finger to push, it’s not comfortable at all. Had the button been on the same side as the spout, it’d be much better and easier on hands. The spout is also tiny. This item is going back.
customer_reviews.author: MsAnonymous

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Keep Coffee Hot
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this cup because it is truly spill proof so I won't need to wear my coffee anymore. The cover is also easy to clean, unlike other cups I have that you are not able to clean well and you wonder what is hiding under the areas you can't reach. The down side is it really doesn't keep your coffee hot that long, even with putting hot water in it before the coffee. The coffee stays warm but no where near hot. I am still happy to know it won't spill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would not be without!
customer_reviews.text: I tend to knock things over,this is a God send for me. And it keeps my coffee hot for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Bonzann

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job - but be sure to read the instruction leaflet
customer_reviews.text: People want travel mugs for different reasons. Mine is to have a hot drink available in the telescope dome during (sometimes very cold) stargazing sessions. This mug is arguably too good for that role. By this I mean that it keeps drinks hot magnificently, so if I load it with boiling tea and look to drink it 1⁄2 hour later the tea will probably be still too hot to drink. The instruction leaflet guides on this. It suggests allowing boiling liquids to cool for 3 minutes or more before loading into the mug. It also advises caution in depressing the pressure button. I have had no issues with this, but I suspect the caution is well advised.
customer_reviews.author: Delta D.

customer_reviews.title: Leak-proof and durable
customer_reviews.text: I love these Contigo AUTOSEAL Stainless Steel travel mugs! They are very durable and leak proof -- great for working around computers all day. I have three older ones without the cap that opens for cleaning. This one cleans up very easily. I love that my hot tea stays hot for several hours, then warm for a couple more! And when I have a cold beverage with ice, it stays cold all day. I've left a drink with ice in the travel mug overnight (6-7 hrs) on the counter; and in the morning there's STILL UNMELTED ICE in it!
customer_reviews.author: birdie59

customer_reviews.title: Dinged but decent.
customer_reviews.text: I've had about a dozen Contigo coffee mugs, and this might be the first that doesn't have a separate piece on the bottom (that inevitably falls off after your husband drops it a few times). That alone was a selling factor. I read several reviews about cups arriving damaged, and alas, mine did as well (hence the missing star).
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Ward

customer_reviews.title: great product so far. Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I like coffee while flying and like it to stay warm throughout the day. Fill it up at the hotel and can shake the sweetener and cream and coffee together because of the great seal. It stays hot for a long while and warm almost the whole day. As with other reviews make sure you release pressure before using while it is upright as it will spray from the other side of the top initially. I have knocked it over many times with no release of contents. You do have to clean it! I just drain and rinse then soap shake drain through drink orifice and then take the top off to clean it thoroughly as per instructions. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney A

customer_reviews.title: This is a Good One!
customer_reviews.text: This was a little hard to use at first - pushing the button behind to drink...but after a couple of uses it became much easier and a habit already. It is for sure leak proof. My bag fell off my car seat this morning and nothing came out on the 20 minute drive to school. I love how the lid "comes apart" to clean. That actually makes me very happy. I do wish it would keep coffee hot a little longer but I guess it is long enough. I do drink a little slower than most I guess. Overall, exceptional leak proof coffee mug!!
customer_reviews.author: Buyz2Much

customer_reviews.title: Favorite coffee cups
customer_reviews.text: Contigo coffee mugs are our go-to coffee cups to bring anywhere outside of the house... and these are no exception! Pros: Keeps your coffee hot for hours! Easy to use Fits in all car cup holders Fairly indestructible — we’ve dropped them plenty of times, my husband even left one on the roof of his car once and drove away and it was fine! Easy to clean Cons: It may take awhile to be able to drink your coffee depending on the temperature it is when you pour it in After many years (5-7) you may notice the plastic piece in the lid can retain some of the coffee flavor
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: This lid is WAY better than the old ones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because even though I love my old Contigo travel cup, the lid was a total PITA to clean right. First off, it took me a while to realize that just washing it wasn't getting gunk out of the hidden parts. When I finally realized it, I started using a pipe cleaner and a darning needle to loosen it up to get out. (GAG! Some of the stuff I got out that had obviously been there for a while.) The new one is worlds easier to clean and I don't have to worry about what disgusting gunk is hiding from me. Just wish they had made a lid like this to fit my old cup. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: suezieqt

customer_reviews.title: I bought 4 of these as I have used them in the past and loved them, our old ones simply needed to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with these Contigo travel mugs. My black mug leaks from the top/seal. I bought 4 of these as I have used them in the past and loved them, our old ones simply needed to be replaced. The black mug hasn't worked since day 1. Such a shame for an expensive mug. Need to contact customer service to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa83

customer_reviews.title: Great mug, Lid Not so Great
customer_reviews.text: I have used these mugs daily for almost 10 months, but unfortunately now both of the lids have broken in different ways. On one of them the spring mechanism that keeps the lid sealed came off. I was able to reattach it twice but the third time was not able to. On the other lid the whole inner mechanism came off (the spring loaded part and the flipping part) and I was not able to reattach them. As much as I love these mugs, I will be purchasing a different brand now because I do not want to have to replace them each year.
customer_reviews.author: Dorie

customer_reviews.title: I'm over Contigo.
customer_reviews.text: This lid is much easier to clean than older styles but now it's hard to sip without drips. Original contigo lids were both leak & drip proof but the devil to keep free of gunk or mold if used for anything but plain water. Every time Contigo changes or "improves" its lids to make cleaning easier, they change the aperture size just enough so new lids can't fit old mugs/tumblers. They should have made everything compatible so we could just replace lids & not have to buy new tumblers as well. I've switched to SimpleModern for better much insulation + interchangeable lids.
customer_reviews.author: Taxi

customer_reviews.title: Good For Most of the Part
customer_reviews.text: The bottle served me well for about 2 years. I used it primarily for water and tea. I’m rating this as a 3 stars only, because potential durability from the design of having the bottom as separated metal piece. I’m not sure how the bottom is attached to the main body. If you inadvertently drop it as I do, the bottle may not dent, but the bottom part will get pushed up or potentially dislodge, making the bottle’s structure fail and inability to keep things hot/cold. Now, it’s also beginning to leak from the top. :-(
customer_reviews.author: JLY

customer_reviews.title: Hot Hot Hot. Buy Buy Buy.
customer_reviews.text: It replaced one that was a shorter 12 oz no spill lid. This is tall and narrow. Tipping it back the coffee comes quickly. It's all pros: The Iid seats inside the rim, spill proof. There is a button on the top that locks the lid in place and makes it leak proof. Totally. I put it in backpacks, rollers, it never leaks, still I shake it to check. An ergonomic button on the front opens the drink slot. Pushing it allows you to blow air through the drink slot to cool the drink. Easy to clean. It's narrow. The lid'just as easy. Keeps drinks hot -hot for about 3 hours G or T. Buy, Buy, Buy, !
customer_reviews.author: Rob D.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes.. Weird.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to use this for coffee because the café near my house offers a discount when I bring my own cup. However no matter how much I washed this out (and I washed it out every time I used it) the taste just got funky. I don't think it was the cup, but the lid that was doing this. I ended up throwing this away shortly after it had paid for itself via café discount :(
customer_reviews.author: Aryana Wills

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile upgrade over older models
customer_reviews.text: Had an older model of Contigo travel mug with its finish peeling and replaced it with this one. The addition of the lock is a nice touch, making it so the button to drink can’t be accidentally pressed inside a purse. The way the mechanism flips out makes cleaning easier than the old models, particularly around the mouthpiece seal. The old one allowed for buildup just inside the mouthpiece, but this one doesn’t. I can’t say anything yet about the integrity of the finish, but the last one peeled because I ran it through the dishwasher rather than hand washing. My fault. I suspect that it’ll hold up fine if I continue to hand wash only, as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: These are my all-time favorite mugs & at this size
customer_reviews.text: These mugs are very special because of the shape and functionality.... and within that, this 16oz size is my favorite. It's just the perfect shape and feel, and the dispense button and functionality is so perfect and usable... it's a true joy to use, hold, etc.... I use it for my water, always have around mug too. Over the years, Contigo has continued to improve the lid design, so it's refreshing to see a company not screwing up a good thing, and even improving it. And best of all, compared to most similar mugs of this quality, they tend to be considerably cheaper than the competition. Keep up the great job Contigo!
customer_reviews.author: nishiko

customer_reviews.title: Happy, So Far
customer_reviews.text: We used Oxo travel mugs for years, but their push buttons wear out pretty fast. Would have gotten more, but they don't seem to be available anywhere. Got these as tryouts. Keep coffee hot much better. Easy to clean. Fit into standard cup holders, (although they are pretty high so they might not fit under your coffee maker. Have to hold button in to drink, which takes a little getting used to, but isn't a deal breaker. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Easy to clean and does its job! Keeps hot drinks hot for hours and it works even better with cold drinks! Spill proof and fits perfectly under my keurig!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, opens to drink, then closes itself. Keeps hot well, keeps cold great...
customer_reviews.text: I have had dozens of kinds of insulated tumblers like this trying to find one that works well. These are by far the best. They never leak. The opener is lockable to prevent accidental opening. You can open the drinking spout with one hand and it closes itself. I have had these for six years, using them every day. They still work great. Recently drove over one, and was glad to see I could still find a replacement. These keep hot drinks as well as any other I have tried, and keep cold drinks very well. These are the very best!
customer_reviews.author: Barnhpr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Leak-proof. Insulation not quite as good as previous Contigo I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. No leaking, but insulation isn’t quite as good as my previous Contigo mug. Worth the money. I’m on the 4/5 star fence.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Aquinas

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT AT ALL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this product because of its inovative design but it doesnt do what it says it does. Everytime i take a sip from it it leaks from the autoseal button that your supposed to press. This is a terrible way to spend $20 and i demand a refund. For anyone who is looking to buy a travel coffee mug i would not reccomend this brand and to chose one thats simpler and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler James Heymann

customer_reviews.title: Warning....watch out for that first sip, it can be really hot!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months, only use this occasionally. Keeps drink hot/cold for a few hours and doesn't leak. But the small sip opening doesn't allow you to feel/sample the temperature of the liquid before it's in your mouth. This can cause you to burn your mouth if the liquid is too hot. SO BE CAREFUL! (I've been unscrewing the cap and checking the temp first before drinking especially if it's not that long since filling) Also, plastic taste seems to be still there. Make sure u take the top.cap mechanism apart (it snaps up and out of the way) for occasional cleaning with a small brush or yucky "stuff" can grow there.
customer_reviews.author: Review and Decide

customer_reviews.title: Release button stops working
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this mug...until I spent quite a bit of money on three of them and within a month the release levers on two of them stopped working. Now I’m down to only one that works and two unusable ones. Money down the drain. I won’t buy any more with a release mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Another quality product from Contigo
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't so sure about the autoseal initially, but after having used it a few times now I can't imagine not having a thermos with it! The autoseal is great at preventing spills and there is a lock button as well which adds to it's leakproof quality. I really love the black matte color, but I will say if you do buy a colored thermos hand wash it rather than putting it in the dishwasher to prevent peeling. Also, because the lid is an autoseal it can be a pain to clean it if you have any thick or sticky liquids in it. Definitely read the instructions before use!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Fran

customer_reviews.title: Total bargain because of color...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps drinks warm or cold for hours (ice in ice water lasts overnight). You can find this same mug for 2x the cost at other retailers, but why? Exact same mug, just in an odd color. Not technically dishwasher safe. If it is like my others, the color will eventually wear off from the dishwasher and it will look plain stainless. Also fits under a single serve coffee brewer, if you remove the drip tray. Auto seal is great. Drip proof, closes as soon as you release button. Easy to drink from one handed. Mechanism in lid opens for easy cleaning. I've got several at least a few years old and I expect this will last as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlock Bonz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but lid is difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I love the design! It is very leak-proof and the lock feature is nice in case you are worried about accidentally pressing the button. Like most water bottles, it does dent somewhat easily and scratch, but take care of it and you'll at least have a scratch-free bottle for a few months. It's a perfect size for a backpack or a bag. The lid is the most difficult part to clean--I have to really scrub it after putting coffee in and then water in, otherwise it tastes like coffee still. I recommend soaking it in water/soap or water/baking soda to get the gunk out between the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: fiona phalange

customer_reviews.title: Tank of a travel mug
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily and have been very happy with it for the last year. It's very durable. I've dropped it off of tables and it's landed on the plastic portion several times with nothing but scratches left. It was also literally hit by a piece of steel swinging from the ceiling that would have broken my arm and it survived with a dent and didn't even spill a drop. Lots of color options, great quality, easy use, my only complaint is that it doesn't fit the small cupholders in my car. (A mistubishi Mirage.)
customer_reviews.author: Kuro

customer_reviews.title: Mostly very good
customer_reviews.text: These cups work super well, until they don't. Just don't drop it, & don't mix up the lids. The red color doesn't hold up, but the other colors seem to stay well. They can be stupid expensive. Amazon is definitely the place to buy them. I have never tried to invoke the warranty, so maybe the ones I have that leak & don't insulate are fixable. That's on me. I recently bought one labeled "Dark Plum." The picture shows a purple-ish greyed tone. It arrived as a startling unpleasant flat grey, not metallic, like every Contigo cup I've seen before. It's too ugly to use, and a hassle to return, though I probably will. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Threadneedle

customer_reviews.title: Own less than a year, and it's going in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mug in April of 2018. There is a button in the lid which controls the flow of liquids. This button no longer works, rendering the entire cup useless. Poor quality. Would not buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M.

customer_reviews.title: My 10th Contigo cup
customer_reviews.text: This is my tenth Contigo cup. I have never had a problem with any of them (my husband has lost all but three of them)...Yes, seriously! I started using these while I was teaching. It keeps the coffee hot as well as keeps cold drinks cold. You NEVER have to worry about the cup leaking or dripping. This made it so nice to keep on my desk, without having to worry about making a mess. I would also just drop the cup inside my brief case without worry. Seriously, if you haven't tried one, you should. They also make wonderful gifts for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Buck

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. They keep my hot drinks hot for several hours, and my cold drinks cold for several hours. The lids can be a bit of a challenge to clean if your drinking something oily like coffee. I use very hot water and a pipe cleaner to get in and get all the gunk from the coffee. I think if the other half would rinse the cup after each use it wouldn't be so gunky. I have NO issues with cleaning mine, I drink tea. They do eventually stop sealing, but I have to say we use our every day and they probably last 3 years. You can order lids only from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: K.Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee mug
customer_reviews.text: My dad never buys himself nice coffee cups so I started doing so the past years. He found an all time favorite that I replaced a couple times. He asked for another one of his favorite coffee mugs for Christmas and I wanted to do an upgrade this time. I was hesitant because he is set in his ways but this cup instantly became his all time favorite. Easy to clean inside it opens up so you get in the nooks & crannies. I know all the contigo mugs don’t have option to clean deep inside so that was a major plus. I paid extra and got the matt black color and it was totally worth it. Doesn’t scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: There’s good and bad about this cup
customer_reviews.text: I love the durability of the cup and I love how it keeps your coffee warm for hours but I do not like is how hard it is to clean and how misleading it was where I thought it was completely dishwasher safe but that’s not the case only the top lid is dishwasher safe the cup is not you have to wash it by hand and also I did not like the fact that the holes that you drink out of our very small which makes it difficult
customer_reviews.author: Savanah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Even a litter of puppies couldn't get this mug to spill
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I drop this or knock it over, it does not spill! Working at an animal rescue it's impossible to drink out of a traditional coffee mug or cup from a take-out place. Tried the stainless cups with the sliding lids and they still spilled. This cup held up at an adoption event when I accidentally left it in a playpen with a litter of puppies. Thankfully not a drop escaped. You never want to chance a puppy getting burned or them ingesting your morning beverage of choice. Have now purchased this is 3 different sizes - love love love this mug!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Marie

customer_reviews.title: drinks doesn't stay hot as mentioned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i always drink hot tea and i wanted something to make it stay hot for a long time. Every time I pour the tea in the mug it doesn't stay hot for that long it only last one hour then it becomes cold. I'm really frustrated because i bought this thinking it would keep my drink hot.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed alsubaie

customer_reviews.title: excellent work coffee mug
customer_reviews.text: i drink 3 to 4 cups of coffee a day, and use this at work. Keeps the coffee hot for hours, longest i tested was about 6 hours, still decent temperature. I drink mine mostly within 2 months, can confirm it holds temperature for those 2 hours with no issues. easy to drink from, the lock button saved me a couple of times. dropped it multiple times from about 3 feet, other than a couple of minor scratches, didn't notice a thing. Best part is nothing spilled. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matt ding

customer_reviews.title: Works completely as advertised, but....
customer_reviews.text: ...but the cup must be tilted almost 90 degrees in order for the liquid to come out, with the button pushed, and while that would be fine if I was drinking water, or juice, that is just too scary to do while the cup is full of almost boiling coffee or tea. Furthermore, this sippy cup holds the heat of the beverage in for a very long time. That said, this product, while working completely as advertised, is no good for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: For the first few times that I tried to drink out of the device, it leaked all over me. I was ready to quit using it. Then, I tried drinking from the other side. No leakage! Great! Keeps my water cold too. The one thing that would have helped is a set of instructions or a diagram of how to use it. I still do not know what the gray lever on the inside of the lid is for. I have poor vision so it may be printed somewhere that I do not see. Also, do not tip the device as it will leak then. Overall, I like it as it saves spilling glasses onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoGene47

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the West Loop Contigo travel mugs! I have had several over the years and I always look for the West Loop configuration. The other travel mugs that Contigo makes have a small drink space which always doesn't flow well. The West Loop ones do, they have a larger drink space which flows well while still sealing exceptionally well. This one has a beautiful color and I will get a lot of use out of it. The West Loop version is very hard to find so I was thrilled to find this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a travel cup for my husband that would keep his coffee nice and hot, so I researched top cups and this was at the top of the list...so I ordered one for him and one for me and mine arrived today. I was skeptical that it’d really keep my coffee hot but I poured a cup with cream a couple of hours ago and my coffee is still so hot it’s burning my mouth! I think my husband is going to LOVE this cup! Highly recommend! I just got it today so if I have any issues I’ll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: New generation cups
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of the original Contigo cups that were marketed by Keurig. The first occasionally leaked, and was replaced. As it developed, both cups had sealing problems, necessitating the removal of the cap and then turning it back on and checking for leaks. Sometimes I spent too much time, and it was frustrating. A relative has one of your new cups, and likes it. I ordered a 20 oz in SS which arrived promptly. I note the distinct change in the pull up mechanism used for cleaning. It solves all the problems I was encountering. The other 2 pretty red cups have been retired, like me.
customer_reviews.author: Harry J.

customer_reviews.title: Much improved insulation.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using another Contigo cup for 5-6 years and I still love for it being leakproof. But this new cup by Contigo, with the autoseal lid is even better, I don't have to worry whether I've closed it properly before accidentally tipping it over on myself. The ability to drink from this cup is difficult to assess because it does such a good job keeping my drink hot that I hardly ever drink directly from the cup, rather using it as a convenient short term thermos. It does take a bit of practice to get used to the pressure required for the lid opener button. Overall, it's worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t recommend this more, actually turned my whole family onto this brand. I’ve had mine for well over a year and it’s still working great. I bought a black one, and while it recommends to hand wash to avoid losing the color, I’ve been washing it in the dishwasher regularly since the day I got it. And I’m just now starting to witness a little wear and tear/peeling when it comes to the black. Does a great job of securely keeping liquids both hot and cold, and I absolutely plan to buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Initially good, but won't last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a couple months ago and used about 7x month. The good: it is easy to drink from and keeps your beverage hot or cold for hours, great insulation. The bad: cleaning isn't the easiest as the spring mechanism can hold grime if you are not very thorough. My main issue is the locking/sealing mechanism, as it failed quickly and now it leaks when closed and locked. Unfortunately I found out the hard way when it leaked coffee into my work backpack, trashing a ton of documents.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Guegan

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed years of use
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Contigo travel mugs for several years now and I have nothing but praise for this product. I actually have to let coffee cool a bit before I pour it into the mug. Otherwise, I have to wait quite some time before it's actually cool enough to drink! I like how the lid guarantees no leaks or accidental spills, which is great for taking your caffeine on the go.
customer_reviews.author: AMG de Wet

customer_reviews.title: These mugs are amazing, and the chill water bottle will help in ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband has wanted one since I bought a pair for my mom for a Christmas gift. These mugs are amazing, and the chill water bottle will help in our Texas heat. Right now as it stands, his regular water bottle just ends up being tepid or hot water disappointment. Love Contigo, and the price was great for a pair!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Mace

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and keep coffee hot
customer_reviews.text: The cup is very good at keeping my coffee hot. It is stylish and seems to be durable. However, the cup I got had a dent on it when I received it. The dent looks like it is an unintentional accident during the delivery (may be from the factory to inventory). The cleaning process is OK if you use a dishwasher. Washing by hand is a bit tough to get it really clean, but it is not really a problem for most people. Overall the product is great and I would recommend others to get it.
customer_reviews.author: WondererBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable travel mug.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 2 of these Contigo travel mugs over 3 years ago. They are as good now as when they were purchased. Hot beverages stay hot, cold stay cold, tops still screw on and off without a problem, no leaks, and the top mechanism still works flawlessly. Each of these is used almost every workday for either hot or iced coffee. and go in the dishwasher at night. Even the silkscreen logos on each side of the mug haven’t worn off. One of the best purchases I have ever made on Amazon and definitely superior to every travel mug my wife and I have ever purchased. A very well made product.
customer_reviews.author: HomeTownUSA

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally have a large coffee tumbler to keep my coffee warm all morning but I was disappointed that the design of this one is flawed as I found myself spilling more coffee on my clothing then actually drinking. I really don't know how anyone can drink from this gadget without spilling it all over the place. Also I found you can only take tiny/ small sips. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

product_meta.title: Contigo AUTOSEAL West Loop Vaccuum-Insulated Stainless Steel Travel Mug, 20 oz, Latte
product_meta.description: Size:20 oz.| Color:LatteHectic mornings are easier with the 16 oz. West Loop Stainless Travel Mug with Easy-Clean Lid, because this mug features a one-touch AUTOSEAL lid that automatically seals between sips to prevent spills. This double-wall vacuum-insulated mug is engineered to keep drinks hot for up to 4 hours or cold for up to 12 hours, without a sweat. We mean that literally, because this vacuum-insulated mug keeps your drink at the optimal sipping temperature and eliminates condensation for dry hands. The AUTOSEAL lid creates an easy one-hand drinking experience and it fits most standard car cup holders, which makes it ideal for the commute! We passionately urge parents, teachers, commuters or anyone on-the-go that loves a hot drink, to grab this mug!.
feature_bullets: Patented AUTOSEAL lid automatically seals between sips to eliminate spills and leaks
Lid underside flips open completely for easy cleaning
Double wall vacuum insulated stainless steel keeps beverages hot for 5 hours or cold for 12 hours
Top rack dishwasher safe lid; 100 percent BPA free
Fits most single serve brewers and car cup holders

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars45,609 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
